{{also|bokmål|bokmal|bókmál}} ==English==
===Etymology=== {{bor+|en|no|bokmål|lit=book language}}. The equivalent {{cog|non|bókamál}} was used in this sense as a name for [[Latin]], as it was the primary language used for writing of biblical work in much of the [[Middle Ages]]. The modern Icelandic name for Norwegian Bokmål is {{m|is|bókmál}}. When dialect research in western Norway was pioneered by {{w|Ivar Aasen}} in the 1850s, {{m|no||bogmaal}} took on the mea ... [truncated]
